page.title: 15EAST RIDDLESDEN HALL
page.content: East Riddlesden Hall is a historic building,and now a museum.It is made up of one main building.Which is the house itself,and it has a large barn It is owned by THE NATIONAL TRUST. Nobody lives in the hall.But two National Trust members live in a cottage in the grounds. It has fifteen rooms and two staircases.When you go in you go straight into the shop which sells all things from within Yorkshire.Then you go through into the Great Hall with a tapespstry on the wall, and it has a large fire place,and a long table with pewter crocery on.Then you go up a staircase into a long gallery.Then you go into the Red Porch Chamber this room has a priests hole and a rose window.Then you go into the Kitchen Chamber,its a large room with a tester bed.Then into the Stairhead Chamber
